intro: Stachys talyschensis, commonly known as the Talysch mountain betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or blue, arranged in whorled clusters along the stem. Stachys talyschensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
